description: Matteo Salvini had hoped to depose the left in Emilia-Romagna and force snap elections.
title: Italy's far-right Salvini fails to gain foothold in key regional election
title_page: Italy's far-right Salvini fails to gain foothold in key regional election - BBC News
maintext: Optimistic opponents believe this shows Mr Salvini's fire burning itself out and that the current government will hold. Others, perhaps realists, say the fact that the left needed mass mobilisation of its voters, helped by a huge street movement - the Sardines - to win in its stronghold against a weak right-wing candidate, shows the threat that Mr Salvini poses and how close he is to gaining power.
